user_request: Show the shopping cart on amazon. Add "macbook air" to the cart on amazon
screen_desc: The screenshot displays the Amazon homepage on a mobile device. At the top, there's a search bar for browsing products and links to deals, categories, and the user’s cart. The central area highlights a banner promoting early Black Friday deals and global shipping. Below, there are product categories such as "Great holiday gifts," "Oculus," and "Women's Fashion." Additionally, a "Home & Kitchen Under $30" section is visible.
history_actions: click on the "Chrome" browser app icon located at the lower right part of the screen.
click on the browser's address/URL bar located at the middle and top part of the screen.
click on the second search suggestion located at middle and upper part of the screen.
click on the shopping cart icon located at the top right.
click on the shopping cart icon located at the top right.

think.Thought: The user request is to show the shopping cart on Amazon and add a 'MacBook Air' to the cart. The current screen shows the Amazon homepage, and we have already accessed the shopping cart previously according to the history actions. However, to add a 'MacBook Air' to the cart, we must first search for the product. The next logical step is to use the search bar at the top of the screen to look up 'MacBook Air'.
Future Action Plan: Click on the search bar at the top of the page to begin a new product search.
Type 'MacBook Air' into the search field and submit the search.
Locate the desired 'MacBook Air' from the search results.
Select the 'MacBook Air' listing to go to its product detail page.
Click on the 'Add to Cart' button on the product detail page to add the MacBook Air to the shopping cart.
